0: Channel 12 anchor Vanessa Ruiz. (Photo: 12 News) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR News anchor Vanessa Ruiz, who joined Channel 12 (KPNX) this summer, certainly caused a commotion this week. Or should we say, “causó un barullo?” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Viewers have pointed out that Ruiz pronounces Spanish words “in Spanish.” To put it in plain English, she says words like “Mesa” and "Casa Grande” the way a native Spanish speaker would pronounce them. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She used some time on the 10 p.m. broadcast on Monday, Aug. 31, to address the situation. She was eloquent and unapologetic. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I was lucky enough to grow up speaking two languages,” she said during the broadcast. “I do like to pronounce certain things the way they are meant to be pronounced, and I know that change can be difficult but it’s normal and over time I know that everything falls into place.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In other words, take that, haters. The story blew up on the Internet (Buzzfeed picked it up) and pretty soon people who have never set foot in Arizona were chiming in. Of course, many weren't happy with what she said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR For the most part, however, Ruiz's commentary was greeted with praise. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR @VanessaR12News sorry I'm a day late.
